content: 1978 flood in Singapore The **1978 Singapore flood** was one of the worst floods in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)'s history. As much as 512 millimetres (20.2 in) of rain fell in just 24 hours from 2 to 3 December 1978. ## Casualties Seven people were killed and more than a thousand residents were evacuated from their homes by the [army](/wiki/Singapore_Army) and [police](/wiki/Singapore_Police_Force) boats from four affected areas. The youngest death was a 10-year-old [primary school](/wiki/Education_in_Singapore) boy who had fallen into a flooded drain. ## Damage Total damage reached [S$](/wiki/S$)10 million, the worst flood since the [Hari Raya](/wiki/Hari_Raya) floods that hit the island in December 1969. 43 buses were badly damaged by the flood. There were reportedly 200 pig carcasses located in the [Kallang River](/wiki/Kallang_River). - [National Library Board](/wiki/National_Library_Board), Singapore's worst floods, 1999. - [MINDEF](/wiki/MINDEF), The Flood of 1978, 7 December 1998.
